lines.text:
[Observing a deserted town]
What the hell's goin' on around here?
Oh... maybe today holiday.
He's right. Today's the day of St. Blanc the Martyr. That's my saint day! Hey, Sheriff, do you mind if I-?
Shut up, Swiss. Sit down. You bring tears to my eyes, but we ain't Catholics in these parts.
Uh-uh-uh, that's right. In America, all prostitutes.

[Annoyed]
Protestants.
Hey, wha- what are you doing there?
I'm preparing poutparri, Japanese style.
Potpourri, not poutparri.
Yeah, yeah, special herbs, that prevent sleeping on hunger. That way, Sakura always stay awake and on guard all night.
Well, if it helps to stop hunger, bring it here. I'll have some.
Oh, we special, Sheriff, we special...
Hey, leave some for me, huh?
You'll need your sleep. You're gonna do a lotta galloping tomorrow.
Ah, it's ready. Ah, ya, oh...
Good, huh?
[He eats some of the potpourri]
Ah, yes... It's good?
It's very good!
[Stops chewing and suddenly cries out in pain]
Immediate effect of herb preparation! You no sleep or feel hungry!

[spits out the potpourri]
BULLSHIT!
[He goes and collapses by a tree]
Sheriff, Sakura do help teethache, and let samurai stop pain!
Well, I can't! Even when I was a kid, the blacksmith had to pull out my tooth, now they're all aching, damn it!
Eh, take it easy, Sheriff, one night will pass quickly.
YOU SHUT UP!

[drunkenly]
You're absolutely right, Swiss. I'm a horse's ass. And... of all th' horse's asses in the world... you... are my real friend.

Now you're really beginnin' to make a little sense. But Black Jack, why did you choose the kind of existence that pays nothing and is full of danger? You got a house full of kids, and a woman who, exceptin' for the beard, could be the twin of Mochako.
Mochako doesn't have a beard.
But Clementine has. Hey, look, we could both be rich, Black Jack. Rich, you hear? Let's open the box and divide up the money, huh? Think about it. Paris.
[Mimes the Can-Can... Black Jack starts to join in]
Yeah, you're right, Swiss. Let's cha-cha-cha-cha the law! And everybody who the hell believes in it! Let's open the box! I've got the- I've got the key!
[He pulls the key out from his pocket]
So let's...
[His hand hovers over one of the three locks. He's forgotten which lock the key fits]
C'mon, what's the matter?
The matter is, I can't remember which lock to open! An-and if we open the wrong lock...
[imitates explosion noises musically]
Very funny. Calm down, there are only three keyholes to choose from. Black, yellow and white. You gotta remember which one it is!

[Despondently]
With all that fire water you gave me to drink, I can't even remember my own name!
Your name is Black Jack! Now come on, now, open this damn box! Come on!
I got it! Eenie, meenie, miney, mo, catch a...
[pauses, then points to the black lock]
That's it!
[He kisses the key, and starts to try and insert the key into the black lock. Swiss stops him]
Hey, wait! Are you sure?
Sure? No.
You're not just drunk! You're crazy!
[He gets up and leaves]
Let me out of this looney bin!
[Black Jack looks fit to cry]
God damn it! The one time I decide to screw the law... I can't remember which lock to use!
[Rests his head, whimpering, on the box]

[Opening lines from Italian version]
For a fistful of dollars. For a miserable fistful of dollars that are not even already your share! At least I did that for a few dollars more... but "vamos a matar", compañeros! Always around in the good, the bad and the ugly times! Head down, dear; you're at the day of reckoning, now!
